Admins.description: List the dashboard administrators in this organization

params.name: email
params.description: The email of the dashboard administrator. This attribute can not be updated.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the dashboard administrator

params.name: orgAccess
params.description: The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the organization

params.name: tags
params.description: The list of tags that the dashboard administrator has privileges on

params.name: tag
params.description: The name of the tag

params.name: access
params.description: The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the tag

params.name: networks
params.description: The list of networks that the dashboard administrator has privileges on

params.name: id
params.description: The network ID

params.name: access
params.description: The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the network

params.name: email
params.description: The email of the dashboard administrator. This attribute can not be updated.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the dashboard administrator

params.name: orgAccess
params.description: The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the organization

params.name: tags
params.description: The list of tags that the dashboard administrator has privileges on

params.name: tag
params.description: The name of the tag

params.name: access
params.description: The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the tag

params.name: networks
params.description: The list of networks that the dashboard administrator has privileges on

params.description: The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the network

Admins.description: Revoke all access for a dashboard administrator within this organization

Clients.sample_resp:
[
  {
    description: "Hayg's Nexus 5",
    mdnsName: "Hayg's Nexus 5",
    dhcpHostname: "HaygNexus5",
    usage: {sent: 1337, recv: 7331},
    mac: "00:18:D3:AD:B3:3F",
    ip: "1.2.3.4",
    id: "lk12uq",
    switchport: null
  },
  ...
]
Clients.description: List the clients of a device, up to a maximum of a month ago. The usage of each client is returned in kilobytes. If the device is a switch, the switchport is returned; otherwise the switchport field is null.

params.name: timespan
params.description: The timespan for which clients will be fetched. Must be in seconds and less than or equal to a month (2592000 seconds).

Config templates.description: List the configuration templates for this organization

Devices.description: List the devices in a network
Return an array containing the uplink information for a device.
Update the attributes of a device

params.name: name
params.description: The name of a device

params.name: tags
params.description: The tags of a device

params.name: lat
params.description: The latitude of a device

params.name: lng
params.description: The longitude of a device

params.name: address
params.description: The address of a device

params.name: moveMapMarker
params.description: Whether or not to set the latitude and longitude of a device based on the new address. Only applies when lat and lng are not specified.

Devices.description: Claim a device into a network

params.name: serial
params.description: The serial of a device

Hotspot20.description: Return the Hotspot 2.0 settings for an SSID

Hotspot20.sample_req: curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X PUT --data-binary '{"enabled":true,"operatorName":"Meraki Product Management","venueName":"SF Branch","venueType":"Unspecified Assembly","networkType":"Private network","domainList":["meraki.local","domain2.com"],"roamConsortOis":["ABC123","456EFG"],"mccMncs":[[123,456],[563,232]],"naiRealms":[{"format":1,"name":"Realm 1","methods":[{"id":"1","params":["Non-EAP Inner Authentication: MSCHAP","EAP Inner Authentication: EAP-TTLS with MSCHAPv2"]}]}]}' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks[networkId]/ssids/[number]/hotspot20'
Hotspot20.description: Update the Hotspot 2.0 settings of an SSID

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not Hotspot 2.0 for this SSID is enabled

params.name: operatorName
params.description: The operator name for this SSID

params.name: venueName
params.description: The venue name for this SSID

params.name: venueType
params.description: The venue type of this SSID ('Unspecified', 'Unspecified Assembly', 'Arena', 'Stadium', 'Passenger Terminal', 'Amphitheater', 'Amusement Park', 'Place of Worship', 'Convention Center', 'Library', 'Museum', 'Restaurant', 'Theater', 'Bar', 'Coffee Shop', 'Zoo or Aquarium', 'Emergency Coordination Center', 'Unspecified Business', 'Doctor or Dentist office', 'Bank', 'Fire Station', 'Police Station', 'Post Office', 'Professional Office', 'Research and Development Facility', 'Attorney Office', 'Unspecified Educational', 'School, Primary', 'School, Secondary', 'University or College', 'Unspecified Factory and Industrial', 'Factory', 'Unspecified Institutional', 'Hospital', 'Long-Term Care Facility', 'Alcohol and Drug Rehabilitation Center', 'Group Home', 'Prison or Jail', 'Unspecified Mercantile', 'Retail Store', 'Grocery Market', 'Automotive Service Station', 'Shopping Mall', 'Gas Station', 'Unspecified Residential', 'Private Residence', 'Hotel or Motel', 'Dormitory', 'Boarding House', 'Unspecified Storage', 'Unspecified Utility and Miscellaneous', 'Unspecified Vehicular', 'Automobile or Truck', 'Airplane', 'Bus', 'Ferry', 'Ship or Boat', 'Train', 'Motor Bike', 'Unspecified Outdoor', 'Muni-mesh Network', 'City Park', 'Rest Area', 'Traffic Control', 'Bus Stop', 'Kiosk')

params.name: networkType
params.description: The network type of this SSID ('Private network', 'Private network with guest access', 'Chargeable public network', 'Free public network', 'Personal device network', 'Emergency services only network', 'Test or experimental', 'Wildcard')

params.name: domainList
params.description: An array of domain names

params.name: roamConsortOis
params.description: An array of roaming consortium OIs

params.name: mccMncs
params.description: An array of MCC/MNC pairs formatted as tuples

params.name: naiRealms
params.description: An array of NAI realms

params.name: format
params.description: The format for the realm ('1' or '0')

params.name: realm
params.description: The name of the realm

params.name: methods
params.description: An array of EAP methods for the realm. Each method has an 'id' property (integer value) and a 'params' property which is the array of authentication types for the method. These types must formatted with the EAP method category followed by a ':' and then the type. (Non-EAP Inner Authentication: Reserved, PAP, CHAP, MSCHAP, MSCHAPV2; EAP Inner Authentication: EAP-TLS, EAP-SIM, EAP-AKA, EAP-TTLS with MSCHAPv2; Credentials: SIM, USIM, NFC Secure Element, Hardware Token, Softoken, Certificate, username/password, none, Reserved, Vendor Specific; Tunneled EAP Method Credentials: SIM, USIM, NFC Secure Element, Hardware Token, Softoken, Certificate, username/password, Reserved, Anonymous, Vendor Specific)

L3 firewall rules.description: Return the L3 firewall rules for an SSID

L3 firewall rules.sample_req: curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X PUT -H 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-binary '{"rules":[{"comment":"a note about the rule", "policy":"deny", "protocol":"tcp", "destPort":"any", "destCidr":"192.168.1.0/24"}], "allowLanAccess":true}' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[networkId]/ssids/[number]/l3FirewallRules'
L3 firewall rules.description: Update the L3 firewall rules of an SSID

params.name: rules
params.description: An ordered array of the firewall rules for this SSID (not including the local LAN access rule or the default rule)

params.name: policy
params.description: Whether or not you want to allow or deny a protocol (value must be 'allow' or 'deny')

params.name: protocol
params.description: The type of protocol (must be 'tcp','udp', 'icmp' or 'any')

params.name: destPort
params.description: The destination port (can be 'any' or an integer within the range of 1-65535)

params.name: destCidr
params.description: The destination IP address or subnet in CIDR form, can also be 'any'

params.name: comment
params.description: A note about the rule

params.name: allowLanAccess
params.description: Boolean value to allow or deny wireless client access to local LAN, true allows access and false denies access

Networks.description: List the networks in an organization

params.name: configTemplateId
params.description: An optional parameter that is the ID of a config template. Will return all networks bound to that template.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new network

params.name: timeZone
params.description: The timezone of the network. For a list of allowed timezones, please see the 'TZ' column in the table in this article.

params.name: tags
params.description: A space-separated list of tags to be applied to the network

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new network

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the new network. Valid types are 'wireless' (for MR), 'switch' (for MS), 'appliance' (for MX or Z1), 'phone' (for MC), or a space-separated list of those for a combined network.

params.name: tags
params.description: A space-separated list of tags to be applied to the network

params.name: timeZone
params.description: The timezone of the network. For a list of allowed timezones, please see the 'TZ' column in the table in this article.

Networks.description: Bind a network to a template.

params.name: configTemplateId
params.description: The ID of the template to which the network should be bound.

params.name: autoBind
params.description: Optional boolean indicating whether the network's switches should automatically bind to profiles of the same model. Defaults to false if left unspecified. This option only affects switch networks and switch templates. Auto-bind is not valid unless the switch template has at least one profile and has at most one profile per switch model.

Networks.description: Unbind a network from a template.
Return the site-to-site VPN settings of a network. Only valid for MX networks.
Update the site-to-site VPN settings of a network. Only valid for MX networks.

params.name: mode
params.description: The site-to-site VPN mode: hub, spoke, or none

params.name: hubs
params.description: The list of VPN hubs, in order of preference. In spoke mode, at least 1 hub is required.

params.name: hubId
params.description: The network ID of the hub.

params.name: useDefaultRoute
params.description: Only valid in 'spoke' mode. Indicates whether default route traffic should be sent to this hub.

params.name: subnets
params.description: The list of subnets and their VPN presence.

params.name: localSubnet
params.description: The CIDR notation subnet used within the VPN

params.name: useVpn
params.description: Indicates the presence of the subnet in the VPN

Networks.description: The traffic analysis data for this network. Traffic Analysis with Hostname Visibility must be enabled on the network.

params.name: timespan
params.description: The timespan for the data.  Must be an integer representing a duration in seconds between two hours and one month. (Mandatory.)

params.name: deviceType
params.description: Filter the data by device type: combined (default), wireless, switch, appliance. When using combined, for each rule the data will come from the device type with the most usage.

Networks.description: List the access policies for this network. Only valid for MS networks.
List Air Marshal scan results from a network

params.name: timespan
params.description: The timespan for which results will be fetched. Must be at most one month in seconds.

Organizations.description: List the organizations that the user has privileges on

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the organization

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the organization

Organizations.description: Create a new organization by cloning the addressed organization

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new organization

Organizations.description: Claim a device, license key, or order into an organization. When claiming by order, all devices and licenses in the order will be claimed; licenses will be added to the organization and devices will be placed in the organization's inventory. These three types of claims are mutually exclusive and cannot be performed in one request.

params.name: order
params.description: The order number that should be claimed

params.name: serial
params.description: The serial of the device that should be claimed

params.name: licenseKey
params.description: The license key that should be claimed

params.name: licenseMode
params.description: Either 'renew' or 'addDevices'. 'addDevices' will increase the license limit, while 'renew' will extend the amount of time until expiration. This parameter is required when claiming by licenseKey. Please see this article for more information.

Organizations.description: Return the license state for an organization
Return the inventory for an organization
Return the SNMP settings for an organization
Update the SNMP settings for an organization

params.name: v2cEnabled
params.description: Boolean indicating whether SNMP version 2c is enabled for the organization

params.name: v3Enabled
params.description: Boolean indicating whether SNMP version 3 is enabled for the organization

params.name: v3AuthMode
params.description: The SNMP version 3 authentication mode either MD5 or SHA

params.name: v3AuthPass
params.description: The SNMP version 3 authentication password.  Must be at least 8 characters if specified.

params.name: v3PrivMode
params.description: The SNMP version 3 privacy mode DES or AES128

params.name: v3PrivPass
params.description: The SNMP version 3 privacy password.  Must be at least 8 characters if specified.

params.name: peerIps
params.description: The IPs that are allowed to access the SNMP server. This list should be IPv4 addresses separated by semi-colons (ie. "1.2.3.4;2.3.4.5").

Organizations.description: Return the third party VPN peers for an organization
Update the third party VPN peers for an organization

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the VPN peer

params.name: publicIp
params.description: The public IP of the VPN peer

params.name: privateSubnets
params.description: The list of the private subnets of the VPN peer

params.name: secret
params.description: The shared secret with the VPN peer

Phone assignments.description: List all phones in a network and their contact assignment
Assign a contact and number(s) to a phone

params.name: contactId
params.description: The ID of the contact (obtained from 'Phone Contacts' API)

params.name: contactType
params.description: The type of contact to bind: 'Dashboard' or 'Google' (obtained from 'Phone Contacts' API)

params.name: publicNumber
params.description:
The public number(s) in E.164 format (obtained from 'Phone Numbers' API) as an array of strings. Multiple numbers per phone are allowed.
    Omitting this paramater will remove the public number assignment(s).

params.name: ext
params.description: The 4-6 digit extension. Extension cannot be in use. Omitting this parameter will remove the extension assignment.

Phone assignments.description: Remove a phone assignment (unprovision a phone)

Phone contacts.description: List the phone contacts in a network

params.name: name
params.description: The full name of the new contact

Phone contacts.description: Update a phone contact. Google Directory contacts cannot be modified.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the contact

Phone contacts.description: Delete a phone contact. Google Directory contacts cannot be removed.

Phone numbers.description: List all the phone numbers in a network
List the available phone numbers in a network

Sm.description: List the devices enrolled in an SM network with various specified fields and filters

params.name: fields
params.description: Additional fields that will be displayed for each device. Multiple fields can be passed in as comma separated values. The default fields are: id, name, tags, ssid, wifiMac, osName, systemModel, uuid, and serialNumber. The additional fields are: ip, systemType, availableDeviceCapacity, kioskAppName, biosVersion, lastConnected, missingAppsCount, userSuppliedAddress, location, lastUser, publicIp, phoneNumber, diskInfoJson, deviceCapacity, isManaged, hadMdm, isSupervised, meid, imei, iccid, simCarrierNetwork, cellularDataUsed, isHotspotEnabled, createdAt, batteryEstCharge, quarantined, avName, avRunning, asName, fwName, isRooted, loginRequired, screenLockEnabled, screenLockDelay, autoLoginDisabled, hasMdm, hasDesktopAgent, diskEncryptionEnabled, hardwareEncryptionCaps, and passCodeLock.

params.name: wifiMacs
params.description: Filter devices by wifi mac(s). Multiple wifi macs can be passed in as comma separated values.

params.name: serials
params.description: Filter devices by serial(s). Multiple serials can be passed in as comma separated values.

params.name: ids
params.description: Filter devices by id(s). Multiple ids can be passed in as comma separated values.

params.name: scope
params.description: Specify a scope (one of withAny, withAll, withoutAny, or withoutAll) and a set of tags as comma separated values.

params.name: batchToken
params.description: On networks with more than 1000 devices, the device list will be limited to 1000 devices per query. If there are more devices to be seen, a batch token will be returned as a part of the device list. To see the remainder of the devices, pass in the batchToken as a parameter in the next request. Requests made with the batchToken do not require additional parameters as the batchToken includes the parameters passed in with the original request. Additional parameters passed in with the batchToken will be ignored.

Sm.description: Add, delete, or update the tags of a set of devices

params.name: wifiMacs
params.description: The wifiMacs of the devices to be modified.

params.name: ids
params.description: The ids of the devices to be modified.

params.name: serials
params.description: The serials of the devices to be modified.

params.name: scope
params.description: The scope (one of withAny, withAll, withoutAny, or withoutAll) and a set of tags of the devices to be modified.

params.name: tags
params.description: The tags to be added, deleted, or updated.

params.name: updateAction
params.description: One of add, delete, or update. Only devices that have been modified will be returned.

Sm.description: Modify the fields of a device

params.name: wifiMac
params.description: The wifiMac of the device to be modified.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the device to be modified.

params.name: serial
params.description: The serial of the device to be modified.

params.name: deviceFields
params.description: The new fields of the device. Passed in as a JSON object. The list of available fields are: name, notes

params.name: wifiMacs
params.description: The wifiMacs of the devices to be locked.

params.name: ids
params.description: The ids of the devices to be locked.

params.name: serials
params.description: The serials of the devices to be locked.

params.name: scope
params.description: The scope (one of withAny, withAll, withoutAny, or withoutAll) and a set of tags of the devices to be wiped.

params.name: pin
params.description: The pin number for locking macOS devices (a six digit number). Required only for macOS devices.

params.name: wifiMac
params.description: The wifiMac of the device to be wiped.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the device to be wiped.

params.name: serial
params.description: The serial of the device to be wiped.

params.name: pin
params.description: The pin number (a six digit value) for wiping a macOS device. Required only for macOS devices.

Sm.description: Force check-in a set of devices

params.name: wifiMacs
params.description: The wifiMacs of the devices to be checked-in.

params.name: ids
params.description: The ids of the devices to be checked-in.

params.name: serials
params.description: The serials of the devices to be checked-in.

params.name: scope
params.description: The scope (one of withAny, withAll, withoutAny, or withoutAll) and a set of tags of the devices to be checked-in.

Sm.description: Move a set of devices to a new network

params.name: wifiMacs
params.description: The wifiMacs of the devices to be moved.

params.name: ids
params.description: The ids of the devices to be moved.

params.name: serials
params.description: The serials of the devices to be moved.

params.name: scope
params.description: The scope (one of withAny, withAll, withoutAny, or withoutAll) and a set of tags of the devices to be moved.

params.name: newNetwork
params.description: The new network to which the devices will be moved.

Ssids.description: List the SSIDs in a network

Ssids.sample_req: curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X PUT -H 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-binary '{"name":"new SSID name", "enabled":true, "authMode":"psk", "encryptionMode":"wpa", "psk":"abcd1234", "ipAssignmentMode":"Bridge mode"}' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[networkId]/ssids/[number]'
Ssids.description: Update the attributes of an SSID

params.name: name
params.description: The name of an SSID

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not an SSID is enabled

params.name: authMode
params.description: The association control method for the SSID ('open', 'psk', 'open-with-radius', '8021x-meraki', '8021x-radius')

params.name: encryptionMode
params.description: The psk encryption mode for the SSID ('wpa', 'wep', 'wpa-eap')

params.name: psk
params.description: The passkey for the SSID. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'psk'

params.name: splashPage
params.description: The type of splash page for the SSID ('None', 'Click-through splash page', 'Billing', 'Password-protected with Meraki RADIUS', 'Password-protected with custom RADIUS', 'Password-protected with Active Directory', 'Password-protected with LDAP', 'SMS authentication', 'Systems Manager Sentry', 'Facebook Wi-Fi')

params.name: radiusServers
params.description: The RADIUS 802.1x servers to be used for authentication. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'open-with-radius' or '8021x-radius'

params.name: host
params.description: IP address of your RADIUS server

params.name: port
params.description: UDP port the RADIUS server listens on for Access-requests

params.name: secret
params.description: RADIUS client shared secret

params.name: radiusCoaEnabled
params.description: If true, Meraki devices will act as a RADIUS Dynamic Authorization Server and will respond to RADIUS Change-of-Authorization and Disconnect messages sent by the RADIUS server.

params.name: radiusAccountingEnabled
params.description: Whether or not RADIUS accounting is enabled. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'open-with-radius' or '8021x-radius'

params.name: radiusAccountingServers
params.description: The RADIUS accounting 802.1x servers to be used for authentication. This param is only valid if the authMode is 'open-with-radius' or '8021x-radius' and radiusAccountingEnabled is 'true'

params.name: host
params.description: IP address to which the APs will send RADIUS accounting messages

params.name: port
params.description: Port on the RADIUS server that is listening for accounting messages

params.name: secret
params.description: Shared key used to authenticate messages between the APs and RADIUS server

params.name: radiusAttributeForGroupPolicies
params.description: Specify the RADIUS attribute used to look up group policies. Access points must receive this attribute in the RADIUS Access-Accept message. The value of the attribute must match the group policy name configured on this page (Filter-Id, Reply-Message, Airespace-ACL-Name, Aruba-User-Role)

params.name: ipAssignmentMode
params.description: The client IP assignment mode ('NAT mode', 'Bridge mode', 'Layer 3 roaming', 'Layer 3 roaming with a concentrator', 'VPN')

params.name: useVlanTagging
params.description: Direct trafic to use specific VLANs. This param is only valid with 'Bridge mode' and 'Layer 3 roaming'

params.name: concentratorNetworkId
params.description: The concentrator to use for 'Layer 3 roaming with a concentrator' or 'VPN'.

params.name: vlanId
params.description: The VLAN ID used for VLAN tagging. This param is only valid with 'Layer 3 roaming with a concentrator' and 'VPN'

params.name: defaultVlanId
params.description: The default VLAN ID used for 'all other APs'. This param is only valid with 'Bridge mode' and 'Layer 3 roaming'

params.name: apTagsAndVlanIds
params.description: The list of tags and VLAN IDs used for VLAN tagging. This param is only valid with 'Bridge mode', 'Layer 3 roaming'

params.name: tags
params.description: Comma-separated list of AP tags

params.name: vlanId
params.description: Numerical identifier that is assigned to the VLAN

params.name: walledGardenEnabled
params.description: Allow access to a configurable list of IP ranges, which users may access prior to sign-on.

params.name: walledGardenRanges
params.description: Specify your walled garden by entering space-separated addresses and ranges using CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.1/24 192.168.37.10/32). Meraki's splash page is automatically included in your walled garden.

params.name: radiusOverride
params.description: If true, the RADIUS response can override VLAN tag. This is not valid with NAT mode client IP assignment.

params.name: bandSelection
params.description: The client-serving radio frequencies. (Dual band operation, 5 GHz band only, Dual band operation with Band Steering)

params.name: perClientBandwidthLimitUp
params.description: The upload bandwidth limit in Kbps. (0 represents no limit.)

params.name: perClientBandwidthLimitDown
params.description: The download bandwidth limit in Kbps. (0 represents no limit.)

Static routes.description: List the static routes for this network

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the static route

params.name: subnet
params.description: The subnet of the static route

params.name: gatewayIp
params.description: The gateway IP (next hop) of the static route

params.name: enabled
params.description: The enabled state of the static route

params.name: fixedIpAssignments
params.description: The DHCP fixed IP assignments on the static route

params.name: reservedIpRanges
params.description: The DHCP reserved IP ranges on the static route

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new static route

params.name: subnet
params.description: The subnet of the static route

params.name: gatewayIp
params.description: The gateway IP (next hop) of the static route

Static routes.description: Delete a static route from a network

  "enabled": true,

  "vlan": 10,

  "poeEnabled": true,

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the switch port

params.name: tags
params.description: The tags of the switch port

params.name: enabled
params.description: The status of the switch port

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the switch port ("access" or "trunk")

params.name: vlan
params.description: The VLAN of the switch port

params.name: voiceVlan
params.description: The voice VLAN of the switch port. Only applicable to access ports.

params.name: allowedVlans
params.description: The VLANs allowed on the switch port. Only applicable to trunk ports.

params.name: poeEnabled
params.description: The PoE status of the switch port

params.name: isolationEnabled
params.description: The isolation status of the switch port

params.name: rstpEnabled
params.description: The rapid spanning tree protocol status

params.name: stpGuard
params.description: The state of the STP guard ("disabled", "root guard", "BPDU guard")

params.name: accessPolicyNumber
params.description: The number of the access policy of the switch port. Only applicable to access ports.

Vlans.description: List the VLANs for this network

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the VLAN

params.name: subnet
params.description: The subnet of the VLAN

params.name: applianceIp
params.description: The local IP of the appliance on the VLAN

params.name: fixedIpAssignments
params.description: The DHCP fixed IP assignments on the VLAN

params.name: reservedIpRanges
params.description: The DHCP reserved IP ranges on the VLAN

params.name: vpnNatSubnet
params.description: The translated VPN subnet if VPN and VPN subnet translation are enabled on the VLAN

params.name: dnsNameservers
params.description: The DNS nameservers used for DHCP responses, either "upstream_dns", "google_dns", "opendns", or a newline seperated string of IP addresses or domain names

params.name: id
params.description: The VLAN ID of the new VLAN (must be between 1 and 4094)

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new VLAN

params.name: subnet
params.description: The subnet of the VLAN

params.name: applianceIp
params.description: The local IP of the appliance on the VLAN

Vlans.description: Delete a VLAN from a network
